verse.roman:
padbhyām ākramya prapade
dry-aṅguly-uttāna-pāṇinā
pragṛhya cibuke 'dhyātmam
udanīnamad acyutaḥ

synonyms: padbhyām—with both His feet; ākramya—pressing down; prapade—on her toes; dvi—having two; aṅguli—fingers; uttāna—pointing upwards; pāṇinā—with His hands; pragṛhya—taking hold of; cibuke—her chin; adhyātmam—her body; udanīnamat—He raised; acyutaḥ—Lord Kṛṣṇa.
translation: Pressing down on her toes with both His feet, Lord Acyuta placed one upward-pointing finger of each hand under her chin and straightened up her body.
